intro: Chiococca nitida var. amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian chiococca, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically glossy and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
